Package com.hiddenswitch.spellsource.impl.util

Interface PersistenceContext<T extends GameEvent>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The GameEvent class that this Spellsource.persistAttribute(String, GameEventType, Attribute, SuspendableAction1) handler argument is handling.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PersistenceContextImpl
    public interface PersistenceContext<T extends GameEvent>
    A context for the persistence API.

    Use this context to get information about the GameEvent, including the GameContext where the event was fired; and, to update inventory items corresponding to an entity on the board (i.e., the card).

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Attribute attribute()
      The attribute this handler was configured to update.
      T event()
      A reference to the event.
      long update​(EntityReference reference, java.lang.Object newValue)
      Updates the entity (or entities) pointed to by the reference with a new value for attribute() this context handles.

    • Method Detail

      • event

        @Suspendable
T event()
        A reference to the event. Access the GameContext with GameEvent.getGameContext(). Note, you can mutate the game context and entities with the referenced game context, since it is the actual context running the game.
        Returns:
        An event.

      • update

        @Suspendable
long update​(EntityReference reference,
            java.lang.Object newValue)
        Updates the entity (or entities) pointed to by the reference with a new value for attribute() this context handles.
        Parameters:
        reference - An EntityReference. Typically, you will use EntityReference.pointTo(Entity) to create a reference that points to a specific entity; but, you may also use references like EntityReference.ALL_MINIONS to update an attribute on all minions currently on the board. See TargetLogic.resolveTargetKey(GameContext, Player, Entity, EntityReference) for the underlying logic of how an EntityReference is interpreted.
        newValue - The new value for the attribute.
        Returns:
        The number of inventory records that were updated.

      • attribute

        Attribute attribute()
        The attribute this handler was configured to update.
        Returns:
        The attribute, or null if this context wasn't associated with a particular attribute.
